item.title: Why Are Americans Drinking Less Cow's Milk? Its Appeal Has Curdled
item.description: May 16, 2017 - In the 1900s, nutritionists and dairy producers helped convince Americans that cow's milk was nature's perfect food. But the science and tastes have changed, and we're guzzling much less than before.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - In the 1900s, nutritionists and dairy producers helped convince Americans that cow's milk was nature's perfect food. But the science and tastes have changed, and we're guzzling much less than before. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/16/528460207/why-are-americans-drinking-less-cows-milk-its-appeal-has-curdled

item.title: Pet Rat In Vancouver Overdoses On Heroin, Saved By Narcan
item.description: May 16, 2017 - Snuggles ate some heroin, according to the woman who brought the little rodent into an overdose prevention site in Canada. Volunteers administered a drug that reverses opioid overdoses.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - Snuggles ate some heroin, according to the woman who brought the little rodent into an overdose prevention site in Canada. Volunteers administered a drug that reverses opioid overdoses. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/16/528622327/pet-rat-in-vancouver-overdoses-on-heroin-saved-by-narcan

item.title: Price's Remarks On Opioid Treatment Were Unscientific And Damaging, Experts Say
item.description: May 16, 2017 - Nearly 700 experts signed a letter to HHS Secretary Tom Price, asking that he correct remarks in which he called medication-assisted treatment for addiction "substituting one opioid for another."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - Nearly 700 experts signed a letter to HHS Secretary Tom Price, asking that he correct remarks in which he called medication-assisted treatment for addiction "substituting one opioid for another." http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/16/528614422/prices-remarks-on-opioid-treatment-were-unscientific-and-damaging-experts-say

item.title: Trump Refusal to 'Bail Out' Insurers Might End Up Making Policies Cheaper
item.description: May 16, 2017 - It's a weird twist: If the government refuses to reimburse insurance companies for cost-sharing subsidies, it could make health insurance a lot cheaper for people buying on the exchanges in 2018.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - It's a weird twist: If the government refuses to reimburse insurance companies for cost-sharing subsidies, it could make health insurance a lot cheaper for people buying on the exchanges in 2018. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/16/528584408/trump-refusal-to-bail-out-insurers-might-end-up-making-policies-cheaper

item.title: GOP Health Bill Penalizes Patients Who Let Insurance Lapse
item.description: May 16, 2017 - In some states, a break in health coverage of more than 63 days would let insurers charge premiums of any price for a year — putting health insurance out of reach for many sick people, analysts say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 16, 2017 - In some states, a break in health coverage of more than 63 days would let insurers charge premiums of any price for a year — putting health insurance out of reach for many sick people, analysts say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/16/528508443/gop-health-bill-penalizes-patients-who-let-insurance-lapse

item.title: The Fox And The Hedgehog: The Triumphs And Perils Of Going Big
item.description: May 15, 2017 - The parable of the fox and the hedgehog tells us that there are some who are guided by one big idea. That's the story of Don Laub, a surgeon whose single-mindedness was his triumph, and his downfall.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - The parable of the fox and the hedgehog tells us that there are some who are guided by one big idea. That's the story of Don Laub, a surgeon whose single-mindedness was his triumph, and his downfall. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/15/528041635/the-fox-and-the-hedgehog-the-triumphs-and-perils-of-going-big

item.title: Why A Man Is On An IV In His Car Outside A Hospital In Yemen
item.description: May 15, 2017 - The cholera crisis — with more than 11,000 cases — is overwhelming the health care system in the war-torn country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - The cholera crisis — with more than 11,000 cases — is overwhelming the health care system in the war-torn country. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/15/528498233/why-a-man-is-on-an-iv-in-his-car-outside-a-hospital-in-yemen

item.title: Psychiatrists Divided Over The 'Goldwater Rule' In The Age Of Trump
item.description: May 15, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks with Jane Mayer of The New Yorker about the debate among psychiatrists within the American Psychiatric Association about breaking from the Goldwater rule and making pronouncements about President Trump's mental health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks with Jane Mayer of The New Yorker about the debate among psychiatrists within the American Psychiatric Association about breaking from the Goldwater rule and making pronouncements about President Trump's mental health. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/15/528502969/psychiatrists-divided-over-the-goldwater-rule-in-the-age-of-trump

item.title: Advocates Push For Trump To Take Swift Action On The Opioid Crisis
item.description: May 15, 2017 - President Trump campaigned promising he would help out in a big way with the opioid crisis. But since taking office, lawmakers and advocates say there isn't much to show for it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - President Trump campaigned promising he would help out in a big way with the opioid crisis. But since taking office, lawmakers and advocates say there isn't much to show for it. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/15/528166453/advocates-push-for-trump-to-take-swift-action-on-the-opioid-crisis

item.title: Doctors Who Are Moms Say They Face Discrimination At Work
item.description: May 15, 2017 - Female physicians with children say they have almost all experienced discrimination at work because of pregnancy, maternity leave or breast feeding.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - Female physicians with children say they have almost all experienced discrimination at work because of pregnancy, maternity leave or breast feeding. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/528168990/doctors-who-are-moms-say-they-face-discrimination-at-work

item.title: Leaving Segregated Neighborhoods Lowers Blacks' Blood Pressure
item.description: May 15, 2017 - African-Americans experienced a drop in blood pressure when they moved from highly segregated neighborhoods to more integrated areas, according to a study that followed people's health for decades.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - African-Americans experienced a drop in blood pressure when they moved from highly segregated neighborhoods to more integrated areas, according to a study that followed people's health for decades. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/527966937/leaving-segregated-neighborhoods-lowers-blacks-blood-pressure

item.title: Stressed-Out High Schoolers Advised To Try A Nap Pod
item.description: May 15, 2017 - A high school in New Mexico is experimenting with light-shielding lounge chairs where frazzled students can rest. Research suggests it leads to calmer, less anxious teens who do better in school.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - A high school in New Mexico is experimenting with light-shielding lounge chairs where frazzled students can rest. Research suggests it leads to calmer, less anxious teens who do better in school. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/527952956/stressed-out-high-schoolers-advised-to-take-a-nap-pod

item.title: Yawning May Promote Social Bonding Even Between Dogs And Humans
item.description: May 15, 2017 - Bears do it, bats do it. So do dogs and humans. They all yawn. It's a common behavior, but why is a bit of a mystery. Researchers think yawning may perk up the brain and help with social bonding.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - Bears do it, bats do it. So do dogs and humans. They all yawn. It's a common behavior, but why is a bit of a mystery. Researchers think yawning may perk up the brain and help with social bonding. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/527106576/yawning-may-promote-social-bonding-even-between-dogs-and-humans

item.title: Racial And Ethnic Disparities Persist In Sudden Infant Deaths
item.description: May 15, 2017 - Babies in Native American and Alaska Native families are at higher risk of sudden unexplained infant death, despite years of effort to reduce the toll. African-American families also face higher risk.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 15, 2017 - Babies in Native American and Alaska Native families are at higher risk of sudden unexplained infant death, despite years of effort to reduce the toll. African-American families also face higher risk. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/15/528173372/racial-and-ethnic-disparities-persist-in-sudden-infant-deaths

item.title: A Mother Finds Joy In Helping A Child Navigate Their Shared Traits
item.description: May 14, 2017 - An unexpectedly rich reward of motherhood is the chance to show your child how to deal with traits passed down from you. A third-generation perfectionist and her daughter compare notes on Mr. P.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 14, 2017 - An unexpectedly rich reward of motherhood is the chance to show your child how to deal with traits passed down from you. A third-generation perfectionist and her daughter compare notes on Mr. P. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/14/528116476/a-mother-finds-joy-in-helping-a-child-navigate-their-shared-traits
